body.p: This page explains the procedure to check whether a device has labels on partition..

section.p:
To check whether a device has labels on a partition, perform the folowing step:
Log on to the Node and use the parted command as follows: sudo parted -lThe output lists all of the block devices. Following is an example output for /dev/sdc. with a single partition and a label of c0a8f502h000. Therefore the device has a label.. . . Model: QEMU QEMU HARDDISK (scsi) Disk /dev/sdc: 20.0GB Sector size (logical/physical): 512B/512B Partition Table: gpt Disk Flags:
Number Start End Size File system Name Flags 1 1049kB 20.0GB 20.0GB xfs c0a8f502h000
. . .
